result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Intentionally Abuse Hazardous Substance, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:09 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffrey A Olson in court.  Attorney Luke K Harrison in court for Jeffrey A Olson. Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of abuse hazardous substance, 5 cts. misdemeanor bail jumping and 2 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-08-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Walmart in Manitowoc, WI and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs, including agents used for huffing.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
